Video Caption: Beijing Winter Olympics: Kremlin "fully supports" skater Valieva in doping row
Comment: Why IOC didn't ban Kamila immediately if she tested positive? Why IOC didn't release full story? The testing was routine check-up randomly in last December, Kamila's urine was sent to Sweden for testing. Why the testing result was just released on Feb 09 after nearly 2 months? Just after ROC got the gold medal of women's figure skatting team? very suspicious.

Video Caption: Beijing Winter Olympics: Kremlin "fully supports" skater Valieva in doping row
Comment: The framing of Russia by the US and its right arm WADA is clear here both in the timing of the disclosure of the positive test result and the media chorus which came after it. Let it be made clear that RUSADA sent Kamila Valieva's blood sample to Sweden for testing on the 25th of December and that the laboratory in Sweden had a time limit of 20 days to return the result according to WADA regulations. Why did it take 45 days for the ITA to return the result and why did they time the disclosure of the positive test result to coincide with the exact moment of the medal presentation ceremony for maximum media coverage? Besides, two positive test results are needed to confirm a banned substance offence since the test itself has a margin of error. In this case we have only one and only a trace was found. Here we are talking about an expired sample and a frame up and this case should be dismissed immediately! As for Moscow's doping history, you just need to check the annual number of doping cases in Russia as compared to other major countries like the US and the UK for example, and you will see that the number of annual doping cases in the UK and US by far surpass those of Russia. So it is legit to question why the US and UK teams have never been sanctioned like Russia has.
